summary: This document is an email chain from September 2019, where an individual in London provides an unsolicited tip to the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York regarding a pilot for Bill Clinton, suggesting the pilot may be involved in or have information about the Jeffrey Epstein scandal. The tipster identifies as one of the pilot's abandoned children and offers to provide more information.

persons.name: Berman
persons.context: The tipster requests their email be forwarded to Mr. Berman, presumably Geoffrey S. Berman, the U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of New York at the time, indicating he is the intended recipient of the information.

persons.name: Bill Clinton
persons.context: Mentioned as the employer of a pilot who the tipster alleges is a sexual predator and may be connected to the Jeffrey Epstein scandal.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Central figure in the scandal; the tipster suggests the identified pilot may be involved in or have information relevant to the Epstein case.

connections.description: The tipster claims the individual in question was a pilot for Bill Clinton.
The tipster identifies as one of the pilot's 'abandoned children'.
The tipster suggests the pilot 'may or may not be involved' in the Epstein scandal, implying a potential connection.

events.title: Tipster's Initial Email
events.description: An individual sends an email to the U.S. Attorney's Office alleging a former Clinton pilot is a sexual predator and may have information on the Epstein case.

events.title: Email Chain Follow-up
events.description: The tipster follows up, surprised they haven't been contacted, and asks who their information was forwarded to.

keyFacts: An anonymous tipster, claiming to be an abandoned child of a pilot for Bill Clinton, contacts the U.S. Attorney's Office with allegations the pilot is a sexual predator and may be connected to the Jeffrey Epstein scandal.
The tipster alleges the pilot changed both his first and last name when obtaining a work permit and residency, and that the pilot's son is a National Security Adviser.
The tipster offers to provide more information, including suggesting an examination of the pilot's flight manifests and lifestyle.
The correspondence shows the tip was received and acknowledged by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York.
